categories.name: Indian Festivals
categories.description: Celebrate India's colorful festivals and traditions

questions.question: Who is credited with starting Ganesh Chaturthi as a public festival?
questions.hint: This freedom fighter popularized it in Maharashtra to unite people! 🐘

questions.question: Which festival is known as the harvest celebration in Kerala with boat races?
questions.hint: It honors King Mahabali and features the snake boat race! 🚣

questions.question: Sankranti or Pongal celebrates what seasonal event?
questions.hint: Farmers thank for the good yield with sweets and kites! 🌾

questions.question: Which festival marks the anniversary of the tenth Sikh Guru, Guru Gobind Singh?
questions.hint: It commemorates the Khalsa's formation in 1699! 🕉️

questions.question: Chhath Puja, a four-day festival in Bihar, is dedicated to which deity?
questions.hint: Devotees fast and offer prayers at riverbanks! ☀️

questions.question: Gudi Padwa in Maharashtra signals the start of which calendar?
questions.hint: Homes are decorated with rangoli and gudis! 🌺

questions.question: Diwali is celebrated on which lunar day in Kartik month?
questions.hint: It's the festival of lights symbolizing good over evil! 🪔

questions.question: Mahavir Jayanti celebrates the birth of which religious figure?
questions.hint: Jain followers observe fasts and processions! 🕉️

questions.question: Christmas in India is a national holiday marking the birth of whom?
questions.hint: Churches light up with decorations and carols! 🎄

questions.question: Dussehra commemorates Lord Rama's victory over which demon?
questions.hint: Effigies of Ravana are burned in grand fairs! 🔥

questions.question: Which festival involves throwing colored powders and water?
questions.hint: It celebrates spring and the triumph of good over evil! 🌈

questions.question: Bihu festival with dances and feasts is from which state?
questions.hint: Rongali Bihu marks the Assamese New Year! 🥳

questions.question: Navratri honors which goddess over nine nights?
questions.hint: Garba and Dandiya dances light up the nights! 💃

questions.question: Eid al-Fitr marks the end of which holy month?
questions.hint: Families share sweets and prayers after fasting! 🌙

questions.question: The Desert Festival in Rajasthan with camel races is held where?
questions.hint: It showcases folk arts in the golden sands! 🐪

questions.question: Lohri celebrates the winter harvest in which region?
questions.hint: Bonfires and bhangra dances warm the night! 🔥

questions.question: Buddha Purnima celebrates the birth, enlightenment, and death of whom?
questions.hint: Bodh Gaya sees thousands of pilgrims! 🛕

questions.question: Karthigai Deepam, a festival of lights, is prominent in which state?
questions.hint: Lamps are lit to honor Lord Shiva! 🪔

questions.question: Guru Nanak Jayanti commemorates the founder of which faith?
questions.hint: Akhand Path recitations fill gurdwaras! 📖

questions.question: Thrissur Pooram features grand elephant processions in which state?
questions.hint: Fireworks and temple rituals make it spectacular! 🐘

categories.name: Indian Culture
categories.description: Discover India's rich heritage and traditions

questions.question: Which classical dance form originates from Uttar Pradesh?
questions.hint: It evolved from storytelling in temples! 💃

questions.question: Bharatanatyam, a classical dance, is famous in which state?
questions.hint: It features expressive mudras and abhinaya! 🕉️

questions.question: Sattriya is a classical dance form of which state?
questions.hint: It was created in Vaishnavite monasteries! 🛕

questions.question: Chhau dance, a martial folk form, belongs to which region?
questions.hint: Masks and acrobatics make it unique! 🎭

questions.question: Kolattam, a folk dance with sticks, is from which state?
questions.hint: It's performed during festivals like Sankranti! 🥁

questions.question: Madhubani paintings, a folk art style, are popular in which state?
questions.hint: Women create these with natural colors! 🎨

questions.question: 'Natya Shastra', the ancient treatise on performing arts, was written by whom?
questions.hint: It guides classical dances and drama! 📜

questions.question: The national anthem 'Jana Gana Mana' was first sung in which year?
questions.hint: At the Calcutta Session of Indian National Congress! 🇮🇳

questions.question: Aipan is a traditional art form of floor paintings from which state?
questions.hint: It's drawn during festivals with rice paste! 🏠

questions.question: Kolam designs are intricate rangoli patterns from which state?
questions.hint: They welcome prosperity at doorsteps! 🌸

questions.question: Thillana is a rhythmic piece in which classical dance?
questions.hint: It ends performances with fast footwork! 🥁

questions.question: Ottan Thullal is a folk dance-drama from which state?
questions.hint: It satirizes society with humor! 😂

questions.question: The words 'Satyameva Jayate' on the national emblem are from which text?
questions.hint: It means 'Truth Alone Triumphs'! ⚖️

questions.question: Garba, a circular folk dance, is associated with which state?
questions.hint: It's danced during Navratri around a lamp! 💃

questions.question: The Sangeet Akademi fosters development of which arts?
questions.hint: India's national academy for performing arts! 🎼

questions.question: 'Sare Jahan Se Achha' was composed by whom?
questions.hint: A patriotic song from 1904! 🇮🇳

questions.question: Kathakali, with elaborate costumes and makeup, is from which state?
questions.hint: It enacts stories from epics like Mahabharata! 🎭

questions.question: The national song 'Vande Mataram' was composed by whom?
questions.hint: From his novel Anandamath in 1882! 📖

questions.question: Mohiniyattam dance, graceful and feminine, developed in which state?
questions.hint: It portrays the enchantress Mohini! 💃

questions.question: Warli paintings, tribal art with geometric patterns, are from which state?
questions.hint: They depict daily village life! 🎨

categories.name: Kids (4–7)
categories.description: Fun and easy questions for little ones

questions.question: What color do you get when you mix red and yellow?
questions.hint: Think of the color of a carrot or an orange fruit! 🥕

questions.question: How many legs does a spider have?
questions.hint: Count your fingers on both hands, that's how many! 🕷️

questions.question: What do bees make?
questions.hint: It's sweet, golden, and goes great on toast! 🍯

questions.question: Which animal says 'moo'?
questions.hint: This animal gives us milk and lives on a farm! 🐄

questions.question: What do we use to brush our teeth?
questions.hint: It has bristles and helps keep your smile clean! 🦷

questions.question: How many wheels does a bicycle have?
questions.hint: Bi means two, just like you have two eyes! 🚲

questions.question: What do fish use to breathe underwater?
questions.hint: They're like slits on the side of their head! 🐟

questions.question: Which shape has three sides?
questions.hint: It looks like a slice of pizza! 🍕

questions.question: What color is the sun?
questions.hint: It's the same color as a banana! 🌞

questions.question: How many days are in a week?
questions.hint: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday... count them all! 📅

questions.question: What do caterpillars turn into?
questions.hint: They get beautiful colorful wings! 🦋

questions.question: Where do birds build their homes?
questions.hint: They're usually high up in trees! 🪶

questions.question: What sound does a cat make?
questions.hint: It rhymes with 'now'! 🐱

questions.question: How many fingers do you have on one hand?
questions.hint: Count them: thumb, pointer, middle, ring, pinky! ✋

questions.question: What do we wear on our feet?
questions.hint: They protect your feet when you walk! 👟

questions.question: What comes after the number 9?
questions.hint: It's 1 followed by 0! 🔢

questions.question: What do we drink to stay healthy?
questions.hint: It's clear and comes from the tap! 💧

questions.question: How many eyes do you have?
questions.hint: One on the left side of your nose, one on the right! 👀

questions.question: What season comes after winter?
questions.hint: This is when flowers start to bloom! 🌸

questions.question: What do cows give us to drink?
questions.hint: It's white and goes great with cookies! 🥛

questions.question: How many continents are there?
questions.hint: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and one more! 🌍

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.hint: It lives in the ocean and can be as long as three school buses! 🐋

questions.question: How many sides does a triangle have?
questions.hint: The shape's name starts with 'tri' which means this number! △

questions.question: What gas do plants need to make food?
questions.hint: It's what we breathe out, and plants breathe it in! 🌱

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.hint: It's named after the Roman god of war and looks reddish! ♂️

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.hint: It's home to the Eiffel Tower! 🗼

questions.question: How many bones are in an adult human body?
questions.hint: It's between 200 and 210! 🦴

questions.question: What is the smallest planet in our solar system?
questions.hint: It's closest to the Sun and very hot! ☿️

questions.question: How many minutes are in an hour?
questions.hint: It's the same as seconds in a minute! ⏰

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.hint: It's between Asia and America! 🌊

questions.question: Which animal is known as the King of the Jungle?
questions.hint: It has a big mane and roars loudly! 🦁

questions.question: How many legs does an insect have?
questions.hint: Ants, bees, and butterflies all have this many! 🐛

questions.question: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.hint: It has spots and can run 70 mph! 🐆

questions.question: Which gas do we breathe to stay alive?
questions.hint: Plants make this gas for us! 🫁

questions.question: How many sides does a hexagon have?
questions.hint: A bee's honeycomb is made of these shapes! 🍯

questions.question: What is the hardest substance found in nature?
questions.hint: It's used in jewelry and can cut glass! 💎

questions.question: Which continent is Egypt in?
questions.hint: It's where the pyramids and Sahara Desert are! 🔺

questions.question: How many teeth does an adult human usually have?
questions.hint: Including 4 wisdom teeth! 🦷

questions.question: What do we call a baby frog?
questions.hint: It swims and has a tail but no legs yet! 🐸

questions.question: Which instrument has 88 keys?
questions.hint: It has black and white keys! 🎹

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.hint: It's not the biggest city, but it's in between Sydney and Melbourne! 🇦🇺

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.hint: This Italian artist was also an inventor and scientist! 🎨

questions.question: What is the smallest unit of matter?
questions.hint: Everything is made of these tiny building blocks! ⚛️

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.hint: It ended the same year the atomic bombs were dropped! 📅

questions.question: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.hint: It flows through Egypt and has pyramids nearby! 🏜️

questions.question: Who wrote 'Harry Potter'?
questions.hint: She created Hogwarts and Quidditch! ⚡

questions.question: What is the formula for water?
questions.hint: Two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom! 💧

questions.question: Which country gifted the Statue of Liberty to the USA?
questions.hint: It was a gift for America's 100th birthday! 🗽

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.hint: It covers your entire body! 🫱

questions.question: How many chambers does a human heart have?
questions.hint: Two atria on top, two ventricles on bottom! ❤️

questions.question: Which planet is closest to Earth?
questions.hint: It's sometimes called Earth's twin! ♀️

questions.question: What gas makes up most of Earth's atmosphere?
questions.hint: It makes up about 78% of the air! 🌬️

questions.question: Who invented the telephone?
questions.hint: He made the first phone call in 1876! ☎️

questions.question: What is the square root of 64?
questions.hint: What number times itself equals 64? 🔢

questions.question: Which empire was ruled by Julius Caesar?
questions.hint: It built many roads and the Colosseum! 🏛️

questions.question: What is the main ingredient in bread?
questions.hint: It's made by grinding wheat! 🍞

questions.question: Which animal is known for changing colors?
questions.hint: It can blend in with its surroundings! 🦎

questions.question: How many strings does a guitar usually have?
questions.hint: You strum them to make music! 🎸

questions.question: What is the currency of the United Kingdom?
questions.hint: It's also called Sterling! 💷

questions.question: Which scientist developed the theory of evolution?
questions.hint: He studied finches on the Galápagos Islands! 🐦

questions.question: What is the capital of India?
questions.hint: It's also called New Delhi and houses the Red Fort! 🇮🇳

questions.question: Who wrote 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.hint: This English playwright also wrote Hamlet and Macbeth! 🎭

questions.question: What is the currency of Japan?
questions.hint: It sounds like 'when' and is symbolized by ¥! 💴

questions.question: Which organ in the human body produces insulin?
questions.hint: It helps control blood sugar and is behind your stomach! 🫀

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
questions.hint: It's often used in engagement rings and cuts glass! 💎

questions.question: Which country has the most natural lakes?
questions.hint: It's the second largest country by area! 🇨🇦

questions.question: What is the most spoken language in the world?
questions.hint: It's spoken by over 1 billion people! 🇨🇳

questions.question: Who painted 'The Starry Night'?
questions.hint: This Dutch artist cut off his own ear! 🌙

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.hint: The Pope lives here and it's inside Rome! ⛪

questions.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'Au'?
questions.hint: Au comes from the Latin word 'aurum'! 🏅

questions.question: How many time zones does Russia have?
questions.hint: It spans from Europe to the Pacific Ocean! 🇷🇺

questions.question: What is the longest bone in the human body?
questions.hint: It's your thigh bone! 🦴

questions.question: Which planet has the most moons?
questions.hint: It has beautiful rings and over 80 moons! 🪐

questions.question: What does 'www' stand for?
questions.hint: It's what you use to browse the internet! 🌐

questions.question: Who wrote '1984'?
questions.hint: He also wrote 'Animal Farm'! 📚

questions.question: What is the fastest bird in the world?
questions.hint: It can dive at over 240 mph! 🦅

questions.question: Which ocean is the Bermuda Triangle located in?
questions.hint: It's between Bermuda, Florida, and Puerto Rico! 🛸

questions.question: What is the most abundant gas in the universe?
questions.hint: It's the simplest element with just one proton! ⚛️

questions.question: Who invented the World Wide Web?
questions.hint: He created it while working at CERN in 1989! 💻

questions.question: What is the deepest point on Earth?
questions.hint: It's in the Pacific Ocean near Guam! 🌊

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for water?
questions.hint: Two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom! 💧

questions.question: At what temperature does water boil?
questions.hint: It's a nice round number in Celsius! 🌡️

questions.question: What force keeps us on the ground?
questions.hint: Sir Isaac Newton discovered this when an apple fell! 🍎

questions.question: How many chambers does a human heart have?
questions.hint: Two on top (atria) and two on bottom (ventricles)! ❤️

questions.question: What is the speed of light?
questions.hint: It's approximately 3 × 10⁸ meters per second! ⚡

questions.question: What is the smallest particle of an element?
questions.hint: It contains protons, neutrons, and electrons! ⚛️

questions.question: Which planet is hottest in our solar system?
questions.hint: Its thick atmosphere traps heat like a greenhouse! ♀️

questions.question: What gas do plants release during photosynthesis?
questions.hint: It's what we need to breathe! 🌱

questions.question: How many bones are babies born with?
questions.hint: More than adults because some fuse together! 👶

questions.question: What is the hardest substance known to man?
questions.hint: It's made of pure carbon in a crystal structure! 💎

questions.question: Which blood type is known as the universal donor?
questions.hint: People with this type can donate to anyone! 🩸

questions.question: What is the most abundant element in the universe?
questions.hint: It's the simplest and lightest element! 🌌

questions.question: How long does it take for light to travel from the Sun to Earth?
questions.hint: About the time it takes to eat breakfast! ☀️

questions.question: What is the pH of pure water?
questions.hint: It's perfectly neutral - not acidic or basic! 💧

questions.question: Which scientist developed the theory of relativity?
questions.hint: E=mc² is his famous equation! 🧠

questions.question: What is the largest organ inside the human body?
questions.hint: It helps filter toxins from your body! 🫀

questions.question: How many teeth does an adult human have?
questions.hint: Including 4 wisdom teeth! 🦷

questions.question: What is the study of earthquakes called?
questions.hint: Scientists use seismometers to measure them! 📊

questions.question: Which gas makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere?
questions.hint: It's colorless and odorless! 🌬️

questions.question: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
questions.hint: It produces energy (ATP) for the cell! ⚡

questions.question: How many players are there in a cricket team?
questions.hint: Same as a football (soccer) team! 🏏

questions.question: In which sport would you perform a slam dunk?
questions.hint: Michael Jordan was famous for these! 🏀

questions.question: How often are the Summer Olympics held?
questions.hint: Same frequency as World Cup and US Presidential elections! 🏅

questions.question: Which country hosted the 2016 Summer Olympics?
questions.hint: The city was Rio de Janeiro with its famous Christ statue! 🇧🇷

questions.question: What is the maximum score possible in ten-pin bowling?
questions.hint: It's a perfect game with 12 strikes in a row! 🎳

questions.question: How many holes are there in a full round of golf?
questions.hint: Tiger Woods has mastered all of them! ⛳

questions.question: In tennis, what does 'love' mean?
questions.hint: It doesn't mean affection in this sport! 🎾

questions.question: Which sport is known as 'the beautiful game'?
questions.hint: It's the most popular sport in the world! ⚽

questions.question: How many players are on a basketball team on court at once?
questions.hint: One for each position: point guard, shooting guard, etc.! 🏀

questions.question: In which sport do you use a shuttlecock?
questions.hint: It's hit back and forth over a high net! 🏸

questions.question: What is the highest possible break in snooker?
questions.hint: It's achieved by potting all balls in perfect order! 🎱

questions.question: How many Grand Slam tournaments are there in tennis?
questions.hint: Wimbledon, US Open, French Open, and one more! 🎾

questions.question: In boxing, how many rounds are in a professional title fight?
questions.hint: Each round is 3 minutes long! 🥊

questions.question: Which country invented rugby?
questions.hint: It started at Rugby School in 1823! 🏉

questions.question: What is the fastest recorded tennis serve?
questions.hint: It was recorded by Sam Groth! 🎾

questions.question: How many minutes are in a football (soccer) match?
questions.hint: Plus injury time added by the referee! ⚽

questions.question: Which swimmer has won the most Olympic gold medals?
questions.hint: He won 23 Olympic golds! 🏊‍♂️

questions.question: In American football, how many points is a touchdown worth?
questions.hint: You can add 1 more with the extra point! 🏈

questions.question: Which sport uses the terms 'birdie' and 'eagle'?
questions.hint: Both are better than par! ⛳

questions.question: How many players are on a volleyball team on court?
questions.hint: They rotate positions after each point! 🏐

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.hint: His face is on the $1 bill and quarter! 🇺🇸

questions.question: In which year did the Titanic sink?
questions.hint: It was the same year New Mexico and Arizona became US states! 🚢

questions.question: Which ancient wonder of the world still exists today?
questions.hint: It's in Egypt and near the Sphinx! 🔺

questions.question: Who was known as the 'Iron Lady'?
questions.hint: She was the UK Prime Minister in the 1980s! 👩‍💼

questions.question: The Berlin Wall fell in which year?
questions.hint: Same year as the Tiananmen Square protests! 🧱

questions.question: Who was the first man to walk on the moon?
questions.hint: He said 'That's one small step for man...' 👨‍🚀

questions.question: Which empire was Julius Caesar part of?
questions.hint: He crossed the Rubicon and was assassinated! 🏛️

questions.question: In which year did World War I begin?
questions.hint: It started after Archduke Franz Ferdinand was assassinated! ⚔️

questions.question: Who painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel?
questions.hint: He also sculpted the statue of David! 🎨

questions.question: Which country was Napoleon Bonaparte from?
questions.hint: He was exiled to Elba and then Saint Helena! 🇫🇷

questions.question: Who wrote the Declaration of Independence?
questions.hint: He later became the 3rd US President! 📜

questions.question: Which ship brought the Pilgrims to America?
questions.hint: They landed at Plymouth Rock in 1620! 🚢

questions.question: Who was the first person to circumnavigate the globe?
questions.hint: Though he died during the voyage, his crew completed it! 🌍

questions.question: Which pharaoh had the Great Pyramid built?
questions.hint: It's also called the Pyramid of Cheops! 🔺

questions.question: In which year did the American Civil War end?
questions.hint: Same year President Lincoln was assassinated! 🇺🇸

questions.question: Who was the last Tsar of Russia?
questions.hint: He and his family were executed in 1918! 👑

questions.question: Which ancient city was buried by Mount Vesuvius?
questions.hint: It was perfectly preserved under volcanic ash! 🌋

questions.question: Who was the first Holy Roman Emperor?
questions.hint: He was crowned on Christmas Day 800 AD! 👑

questions.question: Which wall was built to keep out northern invaders in China?
questions.hint: It's visible from space (though this is a myth)! 🏯

questions.question: Who discovered America in 1492?
questions.hint: Though Vikings had been there earlier! ⛵

questions.question: Which is the largest country by area?
questions.hint: It spans 11 time zones from Europe to Asia! 🇷🇺

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.hint: The Pope lives here and it's inside Rome! ⛪

questions.question: Which river flows through London?
questions.hint: Big Ben and Tower Bridge cross over it! 🌉

questions.question: Mount Everest is located in which mountain range?
questions.hint: It's on the border between Nepal and Tibet! 🏔️

questions.question: Which desert is the largest in the world?
questions.hint: It's covered in ice, but it's still technically a desert! 🧊

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.hint: It's between Sydney and Melbourne! 🇦🇺

questions.question: Which continent has the most countries?
questions.hint: It has 54 recognized countries! 🌍

questions.question: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.hint: It flows through Egypt to the Mediterranean! 🏜️

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest?
questions.hint: It covers about one-third of Earth's surface! 🌊

questions.question: What is the highest waterfall in the world?
questions.hint: It's in Venezuela and drops nearly 1,000 meters! 💧

questions.question: Which country has the most time zones?
questions.hint: It has 12 due to its overseas territories! 🇫🇷

questions.question: What is the deepest lake in the world?
questions.hint: It's in Russia and contains 20% of world's fresh water! 🏞️

questions.question: Which city is known as the 'Big Apple'?
questions.hint: It's home to the Statue of Liberty! 🗽

questions.question: What is the largest island in the world?
questions.hint: It's mostly covered in ice despite its name! 🧊

questions.question: Which strait separates Europe and Africa?
questions.hint: It connects the Atlantic and Mediterranean! 🌊

questions.question: What is the most populous city in the world?
questions.hint: Its metro area has over 37 million people! 🏙️

questions.question: Which country is entirely surrounded by South Africa?
questions.hint: It's a mountain kingdom completely landlocked! 🏔️

questions.question: What is the lowest point on Earth's surface?
questions.hint: It's so salty you can float easily! 🧂

questions.question: Which volcano destroyed Pompeii?
questions.hint: It's still an active volcano near Naples! 🌋

questions.question: What is the capital of Canada?
questions.hint: It's in Ontario, between Toronto and Montreal! 🇨🇦

questions.question: Who is known as the 'King of Bollywood'?
questions.hint: He starred in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge and My Name is Khan! 👑

questions.question: Which movie features the song 'Jai Ho'?
questions.hint: It won an Oscar for Best Original Song! 🏆

questions.question: Who directed the movie 'Sholay'?
questions.hint: The movie featured Jai and Veeru as the main characters! 🎬

questions.question: Which actress is known as the 'Dream Girl'?
questions.hint: She was also a classical dancer and later became a politician! 💃

questions.question: What was Amitabh Bachchan's debut film?
questions.hint: It was released in 1969, but Zanjeer made him famous! 🌟

questions.question: Who composed music for 'Mughal-E-Azam'?
questions.hint: He created the famous 'Pyar Kiya To Darna Kya'! 🎵

questions.question: Which film won India's first Oscar?
questions.hint: Though Gandhi was about India, it was British-made! 🏅

questions.question: Who is known as the 'Tragedy Queen' of Bollywood?
questions.hint: She starred in 'Pakeezah' and 'Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam'! 😢

questions.question: Which movie popularized the dialogue 'Mogambo khush hua'?
questions.hint: Amrish Puri played the villain Mogambo! 🦹‍♂️

questions.question: Who sang 'Lag Ja Gale' in the movie 'Woh Kaun Thi'?
questions.hint: She's known as the 'Nightingale of India'! 🎤

questions.question: Which actor is known as 'Bhaijaan'?
questions.hint: He hosts 'Bigg Boss' and starred in 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan'! 💪

questions.question: Who directed the movie '3 Idiots'?
questions.hint: He also directed 'Munna Bhai' series! 🎓

questions.question: Which movie featured the song 'Tujhe Dekha To Ye Jana Sanam'?
questions.hint: It's still playing at Maratha Mandir! 💕

questions.question: Who played the title character in 'Mughal-E-Azam'?
questions.hint: He played Prince Salim in this epic! 👑

questions.question: Which actress is known as the 'Queen of Bollywood'?
questions.hint: She starred in 'Queen' and 'Tanu Weds Manu'! 👸

questions.question: Who composed the music for 'Lagaan'?
questions.hint: He won an Oscar for 'Slumdog Millionaire'! 🎼

questions.question: Which movie featured the famous train scene romance?
questions.hint: Kajol and Shah Rukh's iconic scene! 🚂

questions.question: Who is known as the 'Perfectionist' of Bollywood?
questions.hint: He starred in 'Dangal' and 'PK'! 🎯

questions.question: Which movie won the National Film Award for Best Feature Film in 2019?
questions.hint: It's a Gujarati film about women's empowerment! 🎬

questions.question: Who played the villain in 'Darr'?
questions.hint: He played an obsessive lover saying 'I love you K-k-kiran'! 😱

questions.question: Who founded Microsoft?
questions.hint: He co-founded it with Paul Allen and made Windows! 💻

questions.question: What does 'WWW' stand for?
questions.hint: It's what you use when you browse the internet! 🌐

questions.question: Which company makes the iPhone?
questions.hint: Their logo is a bitten fruit! 🍎

questions.question: What does 'AI' stand for in technology?
questions.hint: It's what ChatGPT and similar smart systems use! 🤖

questions.question: Which programming language is known for web development?
questions.hint: It runs in web browsers and makes websites interactive! ⚡

questions.question: What does 'CPU' stand for?
questions.hint: It's the brain of the computer! 🧠

questions.question: Who founded Facebook?
questions.hint: He started it at Harvard University! 📘

questions.question: What does 'USB' stand for?
questions.hint: You use it to connect devices to your computer! 🔌

questions.question: Which company developed Android OS?
questions.hint: It's used in most smartphones worldwide! 📱

questions.question: What does 'HTML' stand for?
questions.hint: It's used to create web pages! 🌐

questions.question: Who is the CEO of Tesla?
questions.hint: He also owns SpaceX and X (formerly Twitter)! 🚗

questions.question: What does 'RAM' stand for?
questions.hint: More of this makes your computer faster! 💾

questions.question: Which company created the first personal computer?
questions.hint: The IBM PC set the standard for PCs! 🖥️

questions.question: What does 'WiFi' stand for?
questions.hint: It lets you connect to the internet without cables! 📶

questions.question: Which language is primarily used for Android app development?
questions.hint: Though Kotlin is now also officially supported! ☕

questions.question: What does 'GPS' stand for?
questions.hint: It helps you navigate and find locations! 🗺️

questions.question: Which company owns YouTube?
questions.hint: They bought it in 2006 for $1.65 billion! 📺

questions.question: What does 'IoT' stand for?
questions.hint: Smart homes and connected devices! 🏠

questions.question: Which programming language was created by Guido van Rossum?
questions.hint: It's named after Monty Python's Flying Circus! 🐍

questions.question: What does 'VR' stand for?
questions.hint: You wear special headsets to experience it! 🥽

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.hint: It's named after the Roman messenger god! ☿️

questions.question: How many moons does Earth have?
questions.hint: You can see it glowing at night! 🌙

questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
questions.hint: It has a Great Red Spot and many moons! 🪐

questions.question: Who was the first person to walk on the Moon?
questions.hint: He said 'That's one small step for man...' 👨‍🚀

questions.question: What is the name of our galaxy?
questions.hint: It's named after a creamy white appearance in the sky! 🌌

questions.question: How long does it take Earth to orbit the Sun?
questions.hint: That's why we have a year! ☀️

questions.question: What is the hottest planet in our solar system?
questions.hint: Its thick atmosphere creates a greenhouse effect! ♀️

questions.question: Which planet is known for its rings?
questions.hint: Though all gas giants have rings, this one's are most visible! 🪐

questions.question: What is the closest star to Earth?
questions.hint: It provides light and warmth to our planet! ☀️

questions.question: How many planets are in our solar system?
questions.hint: Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet! 🌌

questions.question: What is the largest moon in our solar system?
questions.hint: It orbits Jupiter and is larger than Mercury! 🌙

questions.question: Which space agency landed the first humans on the Moon?
questions.hint: It was part of the Apollo 11 mission! 🇺🇸

questions.question: What is the coldest planet in our solar system?
questions.hint: Despite Neptune being farther, this one is colder! 🥶

questions.question: How long is a day on Mars?
questions.hint: Very close to Earth's day length! ♂️

questions.question: What is the Great Red Spot on Jupiter?
questions.hint: It's been raging for hundreds of years! 🌪️

questions.question: Which planet rotates on its side?
questions.hint: Its axis is tilted at about 98 degrees! 🌀

questions.question: What is the asteroid belt located between?
questions.hint: It's a region full of rocky objects! 🪨

questions.question: How many Earth years does it take Neptune to orbit the Sun?
questions.hint: It's the farthest planet from the Sun! 🔵

questions.question: What is the name of Saturn's largest moon?
questions.hint: It has lakes of liquid methane! 🪐

questions.question: What causes the northern and southern lights?
questions.hint: Charged particles from the Sun interact with our atmosphere! 🌈

categories.name: Indian States
categories.description: States and Union Territories of India

questions.question: Which is the largest state in India by area?
questions.hint: It's known for the Thar Desert and pink city Jaipur! 🏜️

questions.question: Which state is known as 'God's Own Country'?
questions.hint: It's famous for backwaters, spices, and coconuts! 🥥

questions.question: What is the capital of Punjab?
questions.hint: It's also the capital of Haryana! 🏛️

questions.question: Which state has the highest literacy rate in India?
questions.hint: The same state known as 'God's Own Country'! 📚

questions.question: Gir National Park is located in which state?
questions.hint: It's the only place in the world with wild Asiatic lions! 🦁

questions.question: Which state is known as the 'Land of Five Rivers'?
questions.hint: Punjab literally means 'land of five waters'! 🌊

questions.question: What is the capital of Odisha?
questions.hint: It's known as the Temple City of India! 🏛️

questions.question: Which state is famous for the Sun Temple at Konark?
questions.hint: The temple is designed like a giant chariot! ☀️

questions.question: Which is the smallest state in India by area?
questions.hint: It's famous for beaches and Portuguese heritage! 🏖️

questions.question: Which state is known as the 'Spice Garden of India'?
questions.hint: It produces cardamom, pepper, and cinnamon! 🌶️

questions.question: What is the capital of Assam?
questions.hint: It's actually a part of Guwahati city! 🌿

questions.question: Which state is famous for the Ajanta and Ellora caves?
questions.hint: These ancient rock-cut caves are UNESCO World Heritage sites! 🗿

questions.question: Which state is known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun'?
questions.hint: The sun rises first here in India! 🌅

questions.question: What is the capital of Himachal Pradesh?
questions.hint: It was the summer capital during British rule! 🏔️

questions.question: Which state is famous for Kathakali dance?
questions.hint: Dancers wear elaborate makeup and costumes! 💃

questions.question: Which state has the longest coastline in India?
questions.hint: It has over 1,600 km of coastline! 🌊

questions.question: What is the capital of Tripura?
questions.hint: It's very close to the Bangladesh border! 🏙️

questions.question: Which state is known for the Valley of Flowers?
questions.hint: It's a UNESCO World Heritage site with rare flowers! 🌸

questions.question: Which state is famous for Bharatanatyam dance?
questions.hint: It's one of the oldest classical dance forms! 💃

questions.question: What is the capital of Meghalaya?
questions.hint: It's known as the 'Scotland of the East'! 🏔️
